titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

bioghist.p: The object of the Woman's Interdenominational Missionary Union, Baltimore, Maryland, was to "enlarge our knowledge of missionary work" and to "kindle greater interest and enthusiasm by mutual conference regarding plans and methods used in our several societies."

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the Woman's Interdenominational Missionary Union, Baltimore, 1896-1906. Minutes include topics under discussion and hymns sung. Topics of discussion include: "Our Young People," "Triumphs of Missions," and "Work Among the Colored Peoples." The volume also includes the Union's constitution and several newspaper clippings on the Union and their protest against Brigham Roberts, Congressman from Utah, in 1899.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Presbytery of Baltimore, Stated Clerk James Shera
